titles.title: A bill to amend the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 to change benefit eligibility requirements so that individuals who have completed thirty years of service as an employee and have attained the age of fifty-five years are eligible and so that certain other individuals who have attained the age of fifty-five years and are related to employees are eligible.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to Subcommittee on Transportation, Tourism, and Hazardous Materials.

bill.summary: 1/6/1987--Introduced. Amends the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 to decrease annuity eligibility age requirements from 60 years to 55 years for individuals who have completed 30 years of service. Makes such decrease applicable to certain disabled employees and to spouses and widows of annuitants.
